page.title: 16THE CATTLE MART 2/2
page.content: The cattle mart in Tow Law has had over 100 years of trading. {Store cattle}sales are held in Spring. These animals are bought for re-sale at other marts, or for fattening. {Suckler cattle}sales are held in Autumn. Suckler calves stay with their mothers until weaning; shortly before they are sold. The{Autumn Lamb Sales}of Swaledale and Mules (crossbreed) are very busy times. They are held during September. The lambs are sold to farmers of lowland farms, many of whom come from the Shrewsbury area, for wintering. {As a guide, a sale during May 1985 had {331 ewes and lambs, 294 store cattle {and 18 breeding cattle (including a {Charolais bull) on offer. Average {prices were 102.2p per kilo for {heifers and 217.9p per kilo for lambs.
